message.content:
1. There were increases from baseline in vital signs in the forced-dose study.
2. The forced-dose study involved LDX and OROS-MPH.
3. The mean ± SD increase in systolic blood pressure for LDX in the forced-dose study was 1.6 ± 9.65 mmHg.
4. The mean ± SD increase in diastolic blood pressure for LDX in the forced-dose study was 3.3 ± 8.11 mmHg.
5. The mean ± SD increase in pulse for LDX in the forced-dose study was 6.7 ± 12.78 bpm.
6. The mean ± SD increase in systolic blood pressure for OROS-MPH in the forced-dose study was 2.6 ± 10.15 mmHg.
7. The mean ± SD increase in diastolic blood pressure for OROS-MPH in the forced-dose study was 3.3 ± 9.13 mmHg.
8. The mean ± SD increase in pulse for OROS-MPH in the forced-dose study was 7.6 ± 12.47 bpm.
9. There were increases from baseline in vital signs in the flexible-dose study.
10. The flexible-dose study involved LDX and OROS-MPH.
11. The mean ± SD increase in systolic blood pressure for LDX in the flexible-dose study was 2.4 ± 9.46 mmHg.
12. The mean ± SD increase in diastolic blood pressure for LDX in the flexible-dose study was 2.8 ± 8.41 mmHg.
13. The mean ± SD increase in pulse for LDX in the flexible-dose study was 4.7 ± 11.82 bpm.
14. The mean ± SD increase in systolic blood pressure for OROS-MPH in the flexible-dose study was 0.4 ± 9.90 mmHg.
15. The mean ± SD increase in diastolic blood pressure for OROS-MPH in the flexible-dose study was 2.2 ± 8.64 mmHg.
16. The mean ± SD increase in pulse for OROS-MPH in the flexible-dose study was 6.0 ± 10.52 bpm.
17. The last on-treatment assessment recorded these increases in vital signs.

messages.content:
Statement: Mean ± standard deviation (SD) increases from baseline in vital signs (systolic and diastolic blood pressure, pulse) were observed in the forced-dose study [LDX 1.6 ± 9.65 and 3.3 ± 8.11 mmHg, 6.7 ± 12.78 beats per minute (bpm); OROS-MPH 2.6 ± 10.15 and 3.3 ± 9.13 mmHg, 7.6 ± 12.47 bpm] and the flexible-dose study (LDX 2.4 ± 9.46 and 2.8 ± 8.41 mmHg, 4.7 ± 11.82 bpm; OROS-MPH 0.4 ± 9.90 and 2.2 ± 8.64 mmHg, 6.0 ± 10.52 bpm) at the last on-treatment assessment.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
